      • getDatabaseUrl

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseUrl(java.lang.String driver)
        Get the URL to the database. This is a combination of host, port and database
        Parameters:
        driver - the JDBC driver name (ie: mysql or sqlite)
        Returns:
        database url

      • getDatabaseHost

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseHost()
        Get the database host, defaulting to localhost
        Returns:
        database host

      • getDatabasePort

        public int getDatabasePort()
        Get the database port
        Returns:
        The configured port or 0

      • getDatabaseName

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseName()
        Get the name of the database. Defaults to 'canarymod'
        Returns:
        database name

      • getDatabaseUser

        public java.lang.String getDatabaseUser()
        Get database user This might be null if the datasource is not a password protected database type such as XML.
        Returns:
        database username

      • getDatabasePassword

        public java.lang.String getDatabasePassword()
        Get database password. This might be null if the datasource is not a password protected database type such as XML.
        Returns:
        database password

      • getDatabaseMaxConnections

        public int getDatabaseMaxConnections()
        Get the maximum number of concurrent connections to the database. This might be null if the datasource is not a connection oriented database type such as XML.
        Returns:
        database maximum connections

      • getMaxCachedStatements

        public int getMaxCachedStatements()
        Defines the total number PreparedStatements a DataSource will cache. The pool will destroy the least-recently-used PreparedStatement when it hits this limit.
        Returns:
        config for max cached statements

      • getMaxCachedStatementsPerConnection

        public int getMaxCachedStatementsPerConnection()
        Defines how many statements each pooled Connection is allowed to own. You can set this to a bit more than the number of PreparedStatements your application frequently uses, to avoid churning.
        Returns:
        config for max num of pooled statements per connection

      • getNumStatementCloseThreads

        public int getNumStatementCloseThreads()
        If greater than zero, the Statement pool will defer physically close()ing cached Statements until its parent Connection is not in use by any client or internally (in e.g. a test) by the pool itself.
        Returns:
        config num of threads used to defer closing statements

      • getConnectionTestFrequency

        public int getConnectionTestFrequency()
        Defines the interval of checking validity of pooled connections in seconds.
        Returns:
        connection re-check interval

      • getReturnConnectionTimeout

        public int getReturnConnectionTimeout()
        Defines the time in seconds a connection can stay checked out, before it is returned to the connection pool.
        Returns:
        num of seconds a connection can stay checked out

      • getNumHelperThreads

        public int getNumHelperThreads()
        Defines the amount of threads to use when executing slow JDBC operations, such as closing connections and statements.
        Returns:
        num of threads to use for heavy JDBC operations

      • getMinPoolSize

        public int getMinPoolSize()
        Defines the minimum amount of connections to keep alive in the connection pool.
        Returns:
        min amount of connections

      • getMaxPoolSize

        public int getMaxPoolSize()
        Defines the maximum allowed number of connections in the connection pool.
        Returns:
        max allowed connections in pool

      • getMaxExcessConnectionsIdleTime

        public int getMaxExcessConnectionsIdleTime()
        Number of seconds that Connections in excess of minPoolSize should be permitted to remain idle in the pool before being culled. Set 0 to turn off culling
        Returns:
        seconds to keep excess connections

      • getAcquireIncrement

        public int getAcquireIncrement()
        Determines how many connections at a time to acquire when the pool is exhausted.
        Returns:
        connections to acquire

      • getMaxConnectionIdleTime

        public int getMaxConnectionIdleTime()
        Time to keep idle connections in the pool before they are closed and discarded.
        Returns:
        keep-alive time of connections in pool

        public java.lang.String getBansTableName()
